awd_abstract_narration: This research project will extend the illustrative and                     informal models of iteration in engineering design that are                     available at present.  Formal methods for guiding the refinement                of engineering designs at each iteration will be developed that                 permit the designer to make better decisions during the design                  process.  The set-based representation and manipulation of                      uncertainties in engineering design developed previously will be                extended to combine the imprecise results from each design step to              guide the next step.                                                                 Since engineering design informally converges to a solution                (in most cases) now, we believe that developing a formalism for                 guiding the design refinement will also produce an understanding                of the conditions under which the iterations are convergent.  This,             of course, has profound implications for design, in that very early             indications of the possibility of convergence of several different              candidate designs may be able to guide the designer to pursue (at               least initially) those candidates with the best indications of                  convergence.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
